alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 10:55PM EDT until March 30 at 2:36AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers and locations in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River below Eagle Valley Power Plant, near Centerton, Spencer, Hazleton, Newberry, Petersburg, Edwardsport, Elliston, and Ravenswood. Eel River at Bowling Green. .Rainfall totals late last week as high as one inch, and additional rainfall of one to two plus inches from Tuesday through today, is leading to lowland flooding along the entire length of the Wabash River, on the White River from Centerton downstream, and on the East Fork White River at Seymour. Flooding in Greene County today led to a road closure on State Road 43 between State Road 54 and State Road 58. Flooding on the Wabash and White is expected to last into the first week of April, and on the East Fork White until March 27. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Newberry. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, County Road 550 S in Greene County begins to flood. County Road 600 W just north of the river flooded by possibly more than a foot of water for a short distance in Mary Long Cutoff Area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EDT Wednesday was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.1 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon to 7.2 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
